title: Glen Echo Country Club
text:
Glen Echo County Club, located in <a href="Normandy%2C%20Missouri">Normandy, Missouri</a>, a <a href="St.%20Louis%2C%20Missouri">St. Louis</a> suburb, is a private <a href="country%20club">golf club</a> that was founded by George McGrew and his son-in-law, <a href="Albert%20Bond%20Lambert">Albert Bond Lambert</a>. Completed in 1901, it was the first 18-hole golf course in St. Louis and the first golf course constructed west of the <a href="Mississippi%20River">Mississippi River</a>. The course hosted the <a href="Golf%20at%20the%201904%20Summer%20Olympics">golf</a> events for the <a href="1904%20Summer%20Olympics">1904 Summer Olympics</a>.
History.
The club was designed by <a href="James%20Foulis">James Foulis</a> from <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>, winner of the <a href="1896%20U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">1896 U.S. Open</a>, and built by him and his brother Robert. It opened on 25 May 1901 and hosted the golf events for the 1904 Summer Olympics. The <a href="LPGA%20Tour">LPGA Tour</a> visited the course, hosting the <a href="St.%20Louis%20Women%27s%20Invitational">St. Louis Women's Invitational</a> in 1954, 1964, and 1970.
Hole information.
All information about the holes are from this source.
Other amenities.
The course offers a short range tee and a separate recently regrassed to Zoysia Long range. <a href="driving%20range">driving range</a>, a chipping green, and a practice bunker. It is a <a href="agrostis">bent</a> grass green with allowance for walking and <a href="golf%20cart">golf cart</a>s on the course. The fairways for the course are <a href="Zoysia">Zoysia</a> grass.
Bunkers were renovated in the fall of 2012 Goalby Golf Design and work completed by Glen Echo staff. Bunkers were modified to the old style flat bottomed bunker.
